.. _wx.BusyCursor:

==========================================================================================================================================
|phoenix_title|  **wx.BusyCursor**
==========================================================================================================================================

This class makes it easy to tell your user that the program is temporarily busy.          

Just create a :ref:`wx.BusyCursor`  object on the stack, and within the current scope, the hourglass will be shown. 

For example: 

::

        wait = wx.BusyCursor()

        for i in xrange(10000):
            DoACalculation()

        del wait



It works by calling :ref:`wx.BeginBusyCursor`  in the constructor, and :ref:`wx.EndBusyCursor`  in the destructor. 







         



.. seealso:: :ref:`wx.BeginBusyCursor`, :ref:`wx.EndBusyCursor`, :ref:`wx.WindowDisabler`
